title: Development of a Reinforcement Learning-Based Diabetes Treatment Recommendation System

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory statistics and programming concepts understanding
context.additional_context: Content design focusing on reinforcement learning implementation considering medical data characteristics, supporting smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can orally explain core reinforcement learning concepts (MDP, agent, reward function) within 3 minutes, present two scenarios applicable to medical data (e.g., patient treatment records), and describe three or more considerations when designing reward functions for each scenario.
A pipeline is built to preprocess diabetic patient data and convert it into input formats for reinforcement learning models.

Learners can implement a simple treatment recommendation model (decision tree or linear regression-based) in Python that reflects medical constraints (e.g., drug interactions, patient allergy information) and apply performance evaluation methods achieving 80%+ accuracy and 0.75+ F1-score.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
